block.p: Studio executives have been staying largely silent before a second round of Senate hearings into violent films, video games and recordings. But many of those who work in Hollywood are beginning to chafe at the politicians' barrage.

''I think it's a bunch of weasels scrambling for votes,'' said Larry Kasanoff, the president of a company that makes, among other things, movies based on video games like Mortal Kombat and Duke Nukem.

And Mr. Kasanoff, like several others interviewed, said he felt Washington had unjustly singled out the movie industry, transforming a Federal Trade Commission report about marketing R-rated films to children into a political pile-on.
